Player History
Earned first career win on 4/8/1985...
Had first career hit on 6/14/1985, off Ron Davis (CHC)...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 7/24/1985 (Going to LAD: 3B Mike Schmidt. Going to PHI: P Rick Honeycutt, P Tom Niedenfuer, 3B Scott Fletcher, 2B Steve Sax, RF Ralph Bryant)...
Injured on 9/13/1985 with a Pulled Tricep Muscle, out for 8 weeks...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,685,714 through salary arbitration...
Signed as a free agent by Kansas City on 4/3/1987 to a 1-year deal worth $996,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Los Angeles on 4/3/1988 to a minor league deal...
Signed as a free agent by New York (M) on 2/5/1989 to a 1-year deal worth $675,000 per year...
Won World Series with New York (M) in 1989...
Signed as a free agent by Montreal on 2/10/1990 to a 3-year deal worth $1,950,000 per year...
